metadata.feature_description: Manage the primary/home article for the wiki module

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki module at Community > Wiki
steps.expected: Primary article should be displayed at the top of the wiki page with Edit link
steps.actual: Primary article 'Welcome to the Wiki front page! This is the primary article for the Wiki module.' is displayed with Edit link

steps.action: Click Edit link on primary article
steps.expected: Edit dialog should open with content editor (no title field for primary articles)
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened showing Content field only (no title, tags, or type fields - as designed for primary articles)

steps.action: Modify content using HTML editor and add test text
steps.expected: Content should be modifiable in the editor
steps.actual: Successfully modified content to include 'Updated by Claude on January 9, 2026 for Primary Article Management testing.'

steps.action: Click Publish button to save changes
steps.expected: Changes should be saved and displayed on the wiki page
steps.actual: Changes saved successfully. Primary article now displays updated content with the test timestamp.

steps.action: Open primary article editor and verify title field is absent
steps.expected: Primary article editor should NOT have a title field - primary articles use the module title by design
steps.actual: Confirmed: Edit dialog shows only 'Content: *' field. No title field, no tags field, no article type selector. Primary article uses the module title 'Wiki' as its title.

steps.action: Verify Delete button is visible for moderator/admin users
steps.expected: Delete button should be visible for users with moderator permissions (SuperUser)
steps.actual: Delete button (red) is visible in the edit dialog for SuperUser account, confirming moderator permissions are working correctly

observations: Primary articles are designed without a title field - they use the module title instead (in this case 'Wiki')
Primary article editor hides: title field, tags field, article type selector, and Table of Contents checkbox - showing only content editor
Only users with CanModerate permission see the Delete button for primary articles
The code in ContentEditor.ascx uses Knockout.js bindings with 'primaryArticle' observable to conditionally show/hide fields
SetPrimaryArticle() in ListController.cs stores the primary article reference in the database for each module/group combination
